CatDescriptText: Raymond Johnson, 7212 Tilden Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: I don't think that they should...not unless it is necessary.  For instance, if there are a lot of brothers and sisters and the times are hard, they should be made to help."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Raymond Johnson wearing dark hat, plaid shirt, and plaid jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
